    • Uses of MapTile in core

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private static MapTile MapCreator.createForest​(int xPos, int yPos)  
      static MapTile[][] MapCreator.createMap​(int riverCount, int forestCount)
      Plant trees works like this: [/br] 1. create a vector[/br] 2. choose a random point on the map[/br] 3. create a forest with a radius on each point of the vector's path[/br] 4. reduce the vector's length by 1-2 for x or/and y,[/br] maybe swap x and y or negate them to change direction[/br] maybe split into another vector that will call a similar method with predefined point and vector[/br] 5. use the end point of the last vector as start point and repeat from step 3 until vector is too small[/br] [/br] the top of the map is cold[/br] the middle is tropic[/br] the bottom cold again[/br] [/br] [/br] variations are not types just names, but they can still change the way certain things interact with the tile[/br] Changes may be:[/br] - Different Graphics[/br] - Unit Interactions[/br] - Building Interactions[/br] variations may be:[/br] - Caves/Caverns instead of mountains[/br] - Tundra instead of Plain[/br] - Jungle instead of Forest[/br]
      private static MapTile MapCreator.createPlane​(int xPos, int yPos)
